roleset.name: permit, let, allow

roles.note: No examples of arg2 have been seen in the corpus yet, so I'm not sure how Treebank will handle them, and what the ramifications will be for digging into S nodes to pull out arg2. Once someone sees some examples, perhaps the frame will need to change. (from permission.01-n)

example.name: action is an NP
example.text: Proceeds of the loan agreement, together with funds from Vitro, will permit the purchase of all shares outstanding of Anchor and the payment of all related costs and expenses.
example.arg: the purchase of all shares outstanding of Anchor and the payment of all related costs and expenses

example.name: action is an S, includes embedded agent
example.text: A warrant permits a holder to acquire one share of common stock for $17.50 a share .
example.arg: a holder to acquire one share of common stock for $17.50 a share

example.name: passive
example.text: [U.S. investors]-1 will be permitted *trace*-1 to buy the shares from EC investors 90 days later.
example.arg: *trace*-1 to buy the shares from EC investors 90 days later

example.name: secondary agent in situ
example.text: Warner itself was in negotiations with MGM over certain movie and other rights, and it was ``in Warner-1's interest *trace*-1 to accommodate MGM/UA, Guber and Peters by *trace*-1 permitting them to become MGM executives, ''Mr. Daly said in his affidavit.

example.name: autogen1
example.text: But they have obtained 8300 forms without court permission

example.name: PP arg0
example.text: women can not get a a passport or leave the country without permission of a man

example.name: args 0&1
example.text: A U.S. company is seeking government permission *PRO* to bring genetically altered fish to America 's kitchens .
example.arg: *PRO* to bring genetically altered fish to America's kitchens

example.name: all args
example.text: his parents gave their permission for him to enter the monastery.
